snippet: Officials in Xinjiang said the people were terrorists who had helped orchestrate an attack on a Chinese coal mine in September.
abstract: Chinese authorities acknowledge killing of 28 people suspected in coal mine attack in Xinjiang, region heavily populated by Uighurs, who have increasingly clashed with government.

byline.contributor: Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Officials in Xinjiang said the people were terrorists who had helped orchestrate an attack on a Chinese coal mine in September.

headline.main: China Acknowledges Killing 28 People; Accuses Them of Role in Mine Attack
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: Beijing Confirms Killing 28

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
